results.question: The United States of America was the first country to launch a man into space.
Kublai Khan is the grandchild of Genghis Khan?
The Cold War ended with Joseph Stalin's death.
United States President John F. Kennedy was assassinated during his presidential motorcade in Atlanta, Georgia on November 22nd, 1963.
Sargon II, a king of the Neo-Assyrian Empire, was a direct descendant of Sargon of Akkad.
The Tiananmen Square protests of 1989 were held in Hong Kong.
The man that shot Alexander Hamilton was named Aaron Burr.
Oxford University is older than the Aztec Empire.
The two atomic bombs dropped on Japan by the United States in August 1945 were named 'Little Man' and 'Fat Boy'.
During the Winter War, the amount of Soviet Union soliders that died or went missing was five times more than Finland's.
The United States Department of Homeland Security was formed in response to the September 11th attacks.
Franz Joseph I was the last emperor of Austria.
Thomas Crapper was a plumber who invented the flushing toilet.
The USS Missouri (BB-63) last served in the Korean War.
Japan was part of the Allied Powers during World War I.
The United States of America declared their independence from the British Empire on July 4th, 1776.
Theodore Roosevelt Jr. was the only General involved in the initial assault on D-Day.
The Kingdom of Prussia briefly held land in Estonia.
Joseph Stalin's real name was Ioseb Bessarionis dze Dzugashvili.
Former United States Presidents John Adams and Thomas Jefferson died within hours of each other.
